title: Hybrid Architecture üß¨
ques: Ionic is a **Hybrid** framework. What is the container that runs an Ionic app on a phone?

answer.content:
It runs inside a **WebView** (essentially a headless browser). 
The app is just a regular website (HTML/CSS/JS) wrapped in a native container (Capacitor or Cordova) that displays it fullscreen.

explanation: This allows you to use 100% web tech (Angular, React, Vue) to build mobile apps.

title: Capacitor ‚ö°
ques: What is the role of **Capacitor** (or Cordova) in an Ionic app?

answer.content:
Capacitor acts as the **Bridge** between the Web View and the Native features. 
Standard JS cannot access the Camera or Geolocation natively. Capacitor provides a JS API (`Camera.takePhoto()`) that calls the underlying Native code.

explanation: It empowers the web code to gain superpowers.

title: Performance: Native vs. Hybrid üèéÔ∏è
ques: Historically, Hybrid apps were slower than Native apps. Why? How has this gap closed?

answer.content:
*   **Why:** JS is single-threaded and the DOM is slow. Rendering complex lists in HTML/CSS is slower than native UI.
*   **Improvement:** Modern WebViews are incredibly fast (JIT compilation), and phones are powerful. For 90% of CRUD apps, the difference is negligible today.

explanation: Unless you are building a 3D game, Ionic/Hybrid performance is typically sufficient.

title: UI Components üß©
ques: Ionic provides a library of UI components (like `<ion-card>`). What technology are these based on?

answer.content:
**Web Components** (StencilJS). 
This means they work in any framework (React, Angular, Vue) or plain HTML. They encapsulate their own styles and logic using the Shadow DOM.

title: One Codebase ü¶Ñ
ques: What is the primary business advantage of choosing Ionic over Native (Swift/Kotlin)?

answer.content:
**Code Reuse.** 
You can build the Web App, iOS App, and Android App from **one single codebase**. 
With Native, you need two separate teams (iOS Team + Android Team). Ionic drastically reduces development cost and time.

explanation: The trade-off is performance for efficiency.
